author: All Jonny Services
post_text: March 5, 2015 at 9:20 PM#1Hey guys,Just wondering what the command would be for making a macro that would turn MSC on and off.I'm not to sure on how the menu structure commands work.thanks heaps

posts.author: All Jonny Services
posts.post_text: March 5, 2015 at 9:20 PM#1Hey guys,Just wondering what the command would be for making a macro that would turn MSC on and off.I'm not to sure on how the menu structure commands work.thanks heaps

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: March 5, 2015 at 11:13 PM#2open a commandline feedback window and typelistto see the Root of the database,check for something that could hold MSC settingse.g. #3 "Settings"typeCD 3to change commandline destination to SettingstypeListcheck for something that could hold MSC settingse.g. #5 "MidiConfig"scroll sideways to see all properties of Midiconfige.g.MSCInMode: Disabledenable MSC with Midi or Ethernet via GUIListe.g.MSCInMode: Miditry to change inmode back via commandlineAssign 5 /MSCInMode=DisabledAssign 5 /MSCInMode=Midiwhen you know the Rootpath (Settings>Midiconfig), property (MSCInMode) and values (Disabled/Midi)exit to Root withCD /doublecheck the pathList Root "Settings"."Midiconfig"create macros containingAssign Root "Settings"."Midiconfig" /MSCInMode=DisabledAssign Root "Settings"."Midiconfig" /MSCInMode=Midi

title: Macro for MSC on and off
